content.description: Begin with a short section of offwidth protected by a BD #5 cam. Wander up bolted face on plates and chickenheads and then finish on steep, interesting crack.
content.location: Look for a short 5.7 offwifth that marks the start of the climb.

content.description: Climb up to and though a steep patch of plates and then gain a left leaning crack. Traverse the crack and continue up a pleasant mix of cracks and face to a bolted anchor.To descend, scramble easily to the true summit and do two single rope rappels from bolted anchors.
content.protection: Bolt plus rack to BD #3. There is a bolted anchor at the top.
content.location: Near the left side of the crag.

content.description: Great long route that starts up cracks and then finishes on superbly featured, bolt protected face.Â To descend, scramble easily to the true summit and do two single rope rappels from bolted anchors.
content.protection: Bolts plus rack to BD #3. There is a bolted anchor at the top.
content.location: Far left side of the crag.

content.description: Gain the dihedral that becomes double cracks and then continue up the bolted, well featured face above.To descend, scramble easily to the true summit and do two single rope rappels from bolted anchors.
content.location: Look for a deep dihedral on the far left side of the crag.

content.description: Maybe Pinnacle is situated directly below Hawk Pinnacle and Lost Tower in the Rockfellow massif. It is a great piece of sunny, southeast facing rock. Most of the climbs are long single pitch routes. Even though the rock gets a lot of sun there is plenty of shade available along the base.
